steps.title: 1. Block All Channels
steps.description: Use your bank's mobile app or SMS codes to block Debit/Credit cards and Netbanking access immediately.

steps.title: 2. Report to Cybercrime
steps.description: Call 1930 or log on to cybercrime.gov.in. Keep your transaction details (UTR/Ref No) ready.

steps.title: 3. Notify Your Bank
steps.description: Inform your bank's fraud department within 3 days. This is critical for RBI's 'Zero Liability' protection.

prevention.tip: Enable SMS and Email alerts for all transactions.
Set transaction limits for online and international usage.
Never share OTP, PIN, or CVV with anyone calling as 'Bank Staff'.

rbi_rules.title: Zero Liability
rbi_rules.description: If you report an unauthorized transaction within 3 working days, you have zero liability. The bank must credit the amount back within 10 days.

rbi_rules.title: Limited Liability
rbi_rules.description: If reported within 4-7 working days, your liability is limited (usually up to ₹5,000 to ₹25,000 depending on account type).
